page.title: 09Buildings; Upton Snodsbury.
page.content: Churchill Mill has two mill races below the building and two mill wheels,one under and one over shot. It dates back to the original Domesday book and the present building is 17th century. The mill has not been used regularly for grinding since 1920. There is a weir above the mill. Naunton Court was built in the time of Queen Elizabeth 1st. with black and white timbering on stone foundations. In an upstairs hall the court leet was held. There is a moated farm at Whiteladies Aston and there are several other moats in the area.
